data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about WiFi Connected Smart Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the WiFi Connected Smart Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The WiFi Connected Smart Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of WiFi Connected Smart Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Easy install. Easy install and setup with Alexa.
1#Perhaps quality control did not catch this switch before packing by manufacturer. This wish did not work. Perhaps I got a lemon. I’m returning it.
2#Do the job @ value price / quality control is meh. They do the job at a value price. Quality control could use some help. The 2 smart switches in the photo are this product. We worked hard to make them look the same, to no avail. It’s not a switch I have to look at regularly so we will keep them.
3#Dead On Arrival. Junk! Dead on arrival! Wired correctly and still dead.
4#Works great for my landscape lights. I use this outlet to power my landscape light transformer. You can set the lights to go on and off at dusk and dawn or whenever you please with the Alexa app. Perfection!
5#Easy install and fast setup. Easy installation and fast setup with Alexa. Works great. I am happy I bought it.
6#Great Product. I read some negative reviews on this item, and I was a bit surprised at some of the comments. This switch was super easy to install, and as soon as I powered it up, Alexa discovered and configured it. On the electrical side of the install you need to be able to turn off the breaker in the panel, remove the old switch, connect the wires, and screw the switch into the wall box - this is a process that you’ll need to do with any switch. It’s a great product, and it reasonably priced. 5 STARS!
7#Unstable Connection to WiFi. Instability like no other! Constantly disconnects then reconnects to the WiFi when it decides to. This is unreliable so it leads me to being unable to reliably use my automation. My router is properly set up and is <1 year old so I know it's not my router having these issues.
8#It works but be prepared to replace it every 10 months. It worked fine while it worked. Like a lot of Amazon branded products it doesn't last long.
9#Did not work as it was suppose to. Sent it back was not easy to use
10#Easy to install. It's very convenient to have it. Easy to install
11#Easy to get and install. Easy to install and connect .
12#Junk. Has a mind of its own. This is cheap and easy to install, but garbage. With standard LED light bulbs, it will slightly dim then brighten them about every 10-15 seconds. When I tell Alexa to wake me up at a certain time, it will often turn these lights on by itself. It also randomly turns the lights off. Absolute waste of money and will be replaced asap.
13#Broke after 1 month. Switch died after 1 month and 2 days (stuck in the "on" position and won't turn off), and it was a real battle to get a refund. I still have to hire an electrician to come take out the broken switch. Update: about a month later, while I was on vacation, my AT&T internet went out for about 3 days. When I got home, 5 of the 7 switches I had were also "dead" (I couldn't turn them off or on at the switch). Thankfully I was able to reset them by resetting the main breaker to the circuits these switches were on, but that is totally unacceptable to have to turn off the power to be able to use these as "dumb" switches. If this keeps happening, I'm going to need to hire an electrician again to come take all these pieces of junk out, and replace with some better smart switches. I'm really disappointed because I always thought the Amazon Basic brand was pretty good. I can't really recommend these switches to anyone. Would give 0 stars if I could.
14#Arrived broken. Switch was broken and doesn’t work.
15#Buggy. Buggy. Compared to the other brands, this has reception issues. Disconnects periodically.
16#Must have four wires in your gang box for your light switch. It requires four wires in your light switch box your gang box I run the power to my light, then drop one wire down to the switch. This does not work for me.
17#25% fail rate so far. Ordered four seemed ok, easy install, worked fine. Now, after 5 months one failed. 1 year warranty but amazon has an issue replacing. Took a while with manager but eventually gave me a refund. I will see how long the others will last.
18#Best value in smart wall swtches. East to install and work great. Note: You MUST have the 3rd neutral wire.
19#Works on 3 wires set up. I made it work on a 3 wires set up Green and white wires( smart switch) to the copper wire(house) black wire( smart switch) to Black wire (hot wire) from house Red wire ( smart switch) to white wire ( load wire from the house)
20#Easy installation. From a guy that doesn’t do electrical work, this was pretty easy to install. Now when my wife reminds me I forgot to shut off the light I can just tell Alexa to do it.
21#When installed correctly with proper network settings. WORKS GREAT! For some reason this switch gets a bad reputation and I have no idea why. This was my 4th smart switch and the only one that’s never given me an issue. I run a high network Asus Mesh network and when I replaced it I was worried even with the tri-channel I’d have issues connecting to the 2.4ghz network. Connected flawlessly and I’ve never had a single issue with it. Even after nearly 2 years. It’s been connected and running its routine with no issues. I honestly think the people that have issues either has a 5ghz network only, a cheap “smart” network that isn’t picking up 2.4ghz or didn’t install it correctly. It’s been the only smart switch that I’m willing to order.
22#You need an iPhone to install. The information about this product doesn't make clear that you have to have Alexa and an iPhone to install this timer. If you have an Android phone, you are out of luck.
23#Simple ! Dead simple setup, works as described, Alexa compliant!
24#Not dependable switches. Constantly lost WiFi signal and have to reconnect it to WiFi Dimmer switches cannot handle 12 led ceiling lights. Will work well for the first month and then a constant nightmare.
25#Works well. Use this to control outside lighting. Lets me turn the lights on/off in multiple locations using Alexa.
26#Love these things. I love these switches! Have about 10 in the house. They connect automatically to alexa and can be controlled from anywhere. You can also create routines for the lights to go on on and off on a schedule. Easy to wire ( black is power and red goes to the fixture) a little bit more space is needed in the box for the extra wire- in an exostong box, you need to work carefully amd smartly. In a new box, easier just to get a bigger box from the beginning. A plus in my book
27#Only made to work with 1 gang Amazon switch cover. I installed one of these in a four gang configuration. Unfortunately, the Amazon basics product is only made to be used with the one gang configuration. I had to shove my four gang switch cover onto the four gang switch cover holder because the Amazon basics switch is much thicker than a normal switch. Notice the gap in the picture where the Amazon basic switch is located. The gap is because of the thickness of the Amazon Basics product. If you plan on installing this in a two or more gang switch cover configuration, you may want to go with a different product. The product receives five stars as a singular installation.
28#Going to by more in the future. Works great with my alexa as described.
29#Where did the thin metal tabs go? These things now have THICK plastic tabs to attach to the box. Normal decora cover plates no longer work on them. This is a horrible design.
30#Simple and effective. Simple install and setup , highly recommend
31#Not Z wave. Quite easy to install and functions as promised with Alexa. No regrets with the 5 switches in use and still functioning at 4 months in .
32#Can not be remotely shared with other household members. It seems to work great as a standalone unit or for a single owner. But if you have an Amazon household setup and you need to share devices with them, this will not work. For some reason they sent this to Market without adding an ability to share the device with others in a single household. For me that is a huge problem so I will not be using this as an alternative to the Kasa switches and others which can be shared by linking with third-party skills. Come on amazon, get this working with a connected household!
33#Works. The product was easy to install and connected it self
34#100% failure rate three switches all failed within 3 months. These switches are total s*** I bought three of them and within 3 months all three of them failed they're worthless crap don't buy them under any circumstances.... and I only had some low amperage LED lights attached to them so they weren't overloaded or anything they're just total crap they all failed in the same way
35#Having issues with routines and or "not responding" on Alexa app? Read my review. I've seen a few reviews stating they have issue with the switch not working properly with routines and or it stating not responding. I had the same issue, but I found my router to be the issue. If you have a lot of wifi devices these switches tend to not be handled good by a cheap router. Check your router device capacity. I upgraded to a mesh and made a world of a difference. My household has about 80 devices connected to wifi at any given time. Only time these switches don't work is when my internet goes out. I have about 30 of these switches, ranging from 3 way, dimmable and single pole. All work without a flaw and respond perfectly to routines. Highly recommend.
36#Works directly with Alexa app. The switch was easy to install, and worked immediately with the Alexa app. I really like that it works directly with Alexa app without the need for a third party app.
37#Worked as described. Was easy to install and link.
38#Switch died after a year. Works fine and easy to connect but one of the three I purchased died after a year.
39#Connectivity issues. This switch is close to my router and most of the times have problems connecting to wifi.
40#Works very well. It’s was a single pole switch and was easy to hook up and connect to Alexa. I will buy more after a short trial run.
41#Poor communication with Alexa. I installed the switch, and it is close to both the Alexa and the Router! When you turn on the light via Alexa, it takes about 30 seconds to turn on or off, and I constantly receive a message that the device is not communicating! I do not recommend this switch!
42#Be sure the wiring in the switch location is adequate. This product was easy to install. I watched the video, followed the instructions and voila! Voice activated lights in the den. Also if you’re not on speaking terms with Alexa, the switch works manually. Good product!
43#Okay until the first power outage. The smart switch was working fine until we had a power outage. Once the power came back on, this was the only smart switch that did not work. There was power to the switch because the indicator light was on, but it would not turn on the light it was connected to. The other switches next to this one worked fine. I tried resetting the switch, but it would not reset. I removed the Amazon Basics smart switch and installed a regular switch. The connected light turned back on with the regular switch. This was the only Amazon Basics smart switch I had installed in the house while all the other ones were the Feit smart switches. There were no problems with the Feit switches when the power came back on.
44#Comes on at Random. Easy to install and setup. But after 3 weeks it began to come on at random times. It appears to be a software issue as it seems to come on when Alexa is activated announcing motion at various cameras installed inside and outside of our home or when the internet has a momentary flash off then on. Ordering another brand product.
45#Easy to install. Its a bit slow on the app but with alexa comands are pretty fast
46#Easily Automated outdoor security lights. I installed all three switches in diverse locations. Then connected them to Alexa and created a daily sunrise sunset lights on/off routine on our perimeter lights to work in conjunction with our outdoor Blink security cameras. A terrific system.
47#Easy to program. I bought two. They're working well. I wish there was a little more flexibility with programming to make the house look occupied when I'm away.
48#Incompatible. Don’t sell something that’s only compatible with one smart device
